page.title: 09CONSTABLE BURTON HALL(ctd.)
page.content:
The house contains many beautiful objects,but as it is a family home it is not open to the public.During World War One,however,the house was used as a hospital for injured soldiers.
The grounds are open to the public and are renowned for the display of daffodils in the Spring.There is also an avenue of limes which is very beautiful.
The old driveway,with its imposing entrance gates and balustraded bridge over the beck,can still be seen.A large pond is now used for ducks.A walled garden provides the house with fresh vegetables.
Within the grounds of the Hall there is now a caravan park,popular with the many tourists that visit this area.
